channel.title: Download Manager 2
channel.description:
I doubt I'll get any recognition for this, but I coded this a lot by myself. This was written in Java. It's something like Azureus, except it downloads straight from a server and it's not a torrent client ;D This uses HTTP protocol only!
So, credits to BobDole81. He's sexy as hell.
[url=http://upit.be/download.php?id=3508&act=download]Here[/url] is the download.
I hope you guys like it. I'd like suggestions, but I doubt they can be fullfilled. Kind of a lost project.
Thank you.

item.title: Download Manager 2
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

pwnd, I had a look at your code and the way you have it set up, you only have to add one simple line to make it send a proper user-agent header:

connection.setRequestProperty("Range", "bytes=" + downloaded + "-");
connection.setRequestProperty("User-Agent", "bob");

the “bob” is the user agent it sends, I would just make a public static string with a default of “Java” (which is the default it sends now) and a menu option to change the User-Agent to whatever the user types in

Read full topic

item.title: Download Manager 2
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:6, topic:9466”]1) Each download runs a seperate thread.
2) Open source, but that wouldn’t be to hard to add at all.
3) If it doesn’t recieve a “200” response code, it returns with an error.

AutoJar was supposed to be a feature I felt like adding. It downloads a jar on mondays automatically and option to deobfuscate.

For the Import Theme I was going to work on a theme maker. A gui with dropdowns/ect to select a sexy theme, but I never got to that either.[/quote]

ah ok, that explains the auto jar then

  1. what I meant was somthing similar to DAP, where you can specify the number of threads to run for each file and each different thread downloads a different part of the file, then it strings them all together in the end, its extremely sexy
  2. I know it wouldnt be hard at all, Im just suggesting
  3. the only problem with your error thing, is that it still creates the file, perhaps a good solution would be to delete it if it returns an error?

import theme sounds sexy, are you going to continue to work on it Mr. Java Man? ;D

Read full topic

item.title: Download Manager 2
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

  1. Each download runs a seperate thread.
  2. Open source, but that wouldn’t be to hard to add at all.
  3. If it doesn’t recieve a “200” response code, it returns with an error.

AutoJar was supposed to be a feature I felt like adding. It downloads a jar on mondays automatically and option to deobfuscate.

For the Import Theme I was going to work on a theme maker. A gui with dropdowns/ect to select a sexy theme, but I never got to that either.

[br][size=1]Posted at: August 14, 2006, 09:14:04 PM[/size][hr]Drunken, uploaded for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Download Manager 2
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Drunkenoldma:

Does this make your downloads go faster?

not unless he makes multiple threads connect at the same time, like DAP for example

this is an excellent program pwnd, and open source <3 ;D

things I love about it:

  1. multiple GUI’s
  2. open source
  3. very pretty GUI’s
  4. loading from config file

things that could be improved:

  1. multiple threads to speed up download
  2. being able to choose download directory
  3. handle 403 forbidden errors more gracefully, example: download anything from moparisthebest.com, your program makes the file but cant connect to download, so it just says error
  4. if your really resourceful, you can send a proper header instead of simply “java”

questions:

  1. what is auto-jar? doesnt seem to do anything

looks like this took a lot of time pwnd, I hope you keep working on it, this is probably the best peice of non-rs related java programming I have seen come out of the cheating community ever

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

It’s straight up downloading. No bullshit.

Depends on how fast Java’s HTTP protocol goes
So, I’d assume an exceptionally fast speed.
